job.title: Software Engineer (NYC or US Remote)
job.description: Roofstock is the leading marketplace for investing in single-family rental homes. Our mission is to make real estate investing radically accessible, cost effective and simple. We want to use technology to transform the way real estate is bought and sold and make real estate investing as simple as investing in stocks. Simply put, we are passionate about helping our customers build wealth through real estate.Roofstock has been recognized as a Great Place to Work® and was recently named to the Forbes Fintech 50 and the Red Herring 100 lists of most innovative companies. Roofstock has raised over $135M to date, is based in Oakland, California and Dallas,Texas with approximately 180 people and is growing rapidly. Check out our reviews and see why our employees love working here!We've built an amazing culture where everyone has a voice. We're nice. We get things done. We have fun. We believe in work-life balance (yes, you can really take a vacation). And our values are pretty B.A.D.A.S.S.Be customer obsessed.Act like an owner, because you are one.Don't be afraid to break things in the pursuit of better.All of us are empowered to do the right thing.Stay curious and create what's next. Fast.Seriously. No jerks.At Great Jones, we're out to build the leading full-service operating platform for lower-scale residential rental real estate: tens of millions of single-family homes and apartment buildings without on-site management, collectively worth trillions of dollars but underpenetrated by technology to date.By combining technology and design with best-in-class operations & growth leadership, we will unlock the asset class from previous constraints posted by operational headaches.Technology penetration is low here vs. other asset classes, which just means we have lots of greenfield technology to build!As a Software Engineer here you will roll up your sleeves, work closely with our product & engineering teams, and help build the foundation of various software components. Because we are so greenfield and nothing quite like this has ever been built before, your team will be working with the latest and greatest technologies including AWS-managed services, serverless components, GraphQL, and NLP!You'll help build things like a Mint/Robinhood style app so owners can see and manage their rental properties in real-time from wherever they are with the power of real-time data, smart home automation, and predictive analytics at their fingertips; an Uber-style interface so residents can request maintenance, rate their service experiences, pay their rent, or perform any other interaction or communication; and optimized systemized workflows for everything from leasing to leaky faucets to property optimization.Your team’s work -- delivering software that delights our customers and their tenants, automates and instruments a traditionally low-tech industry, and enables controlled and elegant scaling of the business -- will be an absolutely crucial part of that journey.What You Will DoWork with a Lead Software Engineer and peer engineers to develop new and existing full stack software systems to the highest technical, quality, and accountability standardsCollaborate with a cross-functional team of designers, product managers, and analysts to develop high-quality technical solutions to customer and business problemsEngage in code reviews and help to define and maintain high standards of code qualityCollaborate with other Technology team members and leaders to refine best practices and processesStay current on leading edge technology to help the organization stay at the forefront of industry innovationWhat You Will BringEquipped with 1+ years of professional programming experience, time at a rapidly growing technology organization is a plusProficient in at least one programming language (Python, Go, Node.js , Ruby, or something similar)Backed by a strong understanding of software engineering principles and fundamentals, like data structures and algorithmsEnjoy building new products from scratch, not just improving existing ones. You’ve thrived in similar situations in the past.Successful in an agile work environment, breaking down large pieces of work to deliver value incrementallyProduct sensibility; you have worked closely with product management and design and consider yourself a user-centric thinkerKnowledgeable about modern relational databases, such as PostgreSQL, Oracle, or MySQLExperience with AWS is a plusFor our regular full-time roles we offer a great benefits package!Competitive compensationMedical, Vision and Dental for you (95%) and your dependents (65%)401kFlexible time off and sick daysSupplemental bonus to support "work from home" office needsEquity incentives to give you a stake in the Company’s futureWe are an upbeat and collaborative work cultureVirtual company-sponsored outingsRoofstock is an equal opportunity employer. In keeping with the values of Roofstock, we make all employment decisions including hiring, evaluation, termination, promotional and training opportunities, without regard to race, religion, color, sex, age, national origin, ancestry, sexual orientation, physical handicap, mental disability, medical condition, disability, gender or identity or expression, pregnancy or pregnancy-related condition, marital status, height and/or weight.
